title: Has the distribution of sickness absence changed?
analysis_commentary: The largest percentage of staff took no (0) sickness days in all years (46.1% in 2011, 44.4% in 2012 and 42.4% in 2013); this means that over 50% of staff took at least one sickness day in each year. There has been an increase in the percentage of staff who have taken more than 4.1 sickness days (including categories: '4.1 to 10', '10.1 to 20', '20.1 to 40' and 'more than 40). This increased from 30.0% in 2011 to 34.1% in 2013; the biggest increase was seen in the '4.1 to 10' category. This shift to the groups with more sickness days explains the increase in average we saw in the previous chart.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Personal Social Services: Staff of Social Services Departments
